cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest, then turning north and paralleling the southeast U.S. coastline just offshore
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal brush near the Florida east coast (no direct Florida landfall presently forecast)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch, Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL (T.S. Watch); North of Deerfield Beach FL to south of Lantana FL (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Broward County; Hurricane/T.S. warnings begin farther north (Jupiter Inlet-Ponte Vedra Beach)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Florida coastline from Golden Beach through Jupiter Inlet, including Port Everglades
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) possible late Tuesday through Wednesday; low (4%) chance of 50-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–6 in., locally higher, could cause flash flooding in low-lying port areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief coastal tornadoes possible
